attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: Stop HS2! Spend the money on the NHS
attributes.background: We need to scrap this project and reinvest the money in the NHS. Either that or refurbish the existing transport network. Save our tax money! Save our countryside! Save our towns and villages! Save our community's! And Save our homes!

attributes.action: Recognise care work is a skilled job and put a banding system in place
attributes.background: The average care worker is paid the minimum wage give or take 5%, regardless of whether or not they have experience and qualifications. It is said to be unskilled, yet there are various care qualifications sought after by employers. Why? Because care work is a skilled job which requires training!
attributes.additional_details: The current care system fails both care workers and service users. I propose that HCAs have a banding system. Band 1 will be apprentice carers, paid the minimum wage, band 2 will be level 2 carers and be paid 25%+ above minimum wage, band 3 (senior) +50%, and band 4 (deputy/coordinator) +75%. I also propose band 1 cannot lone work until 6 months shadowing has been done. This will encourage training, ensuring the quality of care provided is of the standard it desperately needs to be!

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: All Vegan products on sale in the UK should bear a standard identifying logo.
attributes.background: Shopping for Vegan products in the UK is notoriously difficult. Especially for those who are even the slightly visually impaired as ingredient lists are often in tiny print. This should include all food & drink products, health care & beauty products and clothing including shoes.

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: BRCA - Provide a consistent approach to advice, care and support across the UK
attributes.background: There is an inconsistent approach to advice, care and support given to BRCA women and men across the UK. Women and men are being diagnosed with cancer every day when it could have been prevented. Let's make this change.
attributes.additional_details:
A questionnaire is currently underway to collate the inconsistencies from the health care. But some examples so far are;
1. Surveillance options for breast and Ovarian Cancer varies (available in some areas)
2. Assigned geneticists 
3. Inconsistent advice for BSO  
4. Availability of PGD / IVF 
5. Waiting times to see the breast surgeons
6. Availability of testing 

These are some. I am BRCA1 positive, Ambassador for BRCA Umbrella and Voice for OCA. I see it every day and it needs changing.

attributes.action: Give Ofcom power to enforce impartiality and accuracy of the BBC
attributes.background: Giving Ofcom the power to enforce this policy, for accurate information is essential to democracy. At present the BBC is failing the nation, discarding all pretence at impartiality and balanced reporting, becoming a voice for an international elite, & suppressing news not welcome to its own agenda.
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC has a unique position in British life; funded by the people individually, it belongs to all & has an ethical & constitutional duty to provide accurate & unbiased information & balanced comment. It has lamentably failed this duty in recent years, in Referendum debates, and even more so afterwards by hysterically talking down the future prospects of the country, increasing division, distrust, & anger & encouraging anxiety & fear in the young
more at http://www.facebook.com/BBCNewsPetition

attributes.action: Proscribe the extremist group Britain First
attributes.background: Far right propaganda on the internet and social media is all pervasive. Britain First's Facebook page reaches and influences millions a week. The Govt must proscribe Britain First .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/britain-first-muslim-elected-officials_uk_574352c4e4b0e71ef36d9617?edition=uk&b52pke8u54myousor

http://www.politics.co.uk/news/2014/06/19/britain-first-the-violent-new-face-of-british-fascism

These are just 2 of many links showing just how dangerous Britain First are.

attributes.action: Allow the British people to bear arms again
attributes.background: Because of the constant threat of islamic terrorism the British people should be allowed to bear arms in order to protect their families,
attributes.additional_details: Throughout Europe Islamic terrorists have killed hundreds of innocent people & to try to save lives then the British public should once again be allowed to carry guns to defend their loved ones from harm, We the British people want the same rights afforded to the people of the USA, France & Germany who do have the means to defend themselves when needed!!!

attributes.action: Remove Cannabis And Hemp From The 1971 Misuse Of Drugs Act
attributes.background: The law states cannabis has no medicinal value, science has shown cannabis has a vast medicinal profile and can help with a plethora of health problems humans have an endocannabinoid system with autoregulatory homeostatic mechanisms cannabinoids ARE FUNDAMENTAL for protection and maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
There is no scientific justification for the current scheduling of cannabis and hemp in the 1971 drugs act, the law violates the right to the highest attainable standard of health.The goverment must repeal the law to allow people to OBTAIN this FUNDAMENTAL SUPPLIMENT / FORTHWITH 
cannabis is available in 29 states of America,Spain,Holland,Canada,Portugal, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legality_of_cannabis_by_country

attributes.action: Highways England to set 50mph speed limit on A34 between Chieveley & West Ilsley
attributes.background: The A34 between Chieveley and West Ilsley currently has a national speed limit (70mph) and carries significant volumes of traffic past slip-roads with very poor intervisibility between vehicles joining and proceeding along the A34 at East Ilsley and Beedon. This results in frequent accidents.

attributes.action: A complete ban of the Hijab in our armed services and our emergency services.
attributes.background: The armed and emergency services are here to serve Britain. Anyone who moves here and wants to join should respect the role and the uniform.  It should not be changed to suit their needs. The face should be displayed at all times as its is a figure of respect.  The Hijab is a health & safety risk

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Call Government to legislate & implement Lynn Faulds Wood Consumer Recall Report
attributes.background: The Lynn Faulds Wood review calls for an overhaul of the consumer product recall system in this country. This has been highlighted by the situation with Whirlpool. Without Government legislation, as one MP stated, companies will continue with 'corporate malpractice' with no thought for the consumer.
attributes.additional_details:
UK consumer product recall, An independent review by Lynn Faulds Wood
Adjournment debate by Andy Slaughter MP, Faulty Tumble Dryers (Fire Risk) on 13th September 2016

attributes.action:
Mandatory training in education 
re impact of abuse/trauma on children
attributes.background: Children who no longer remain with birth families often have attachment difficulties & a history of witnessing/experiencing abusive trauma regardless of the age they were removed, this is rarely understood by teachers or school staff. This needs to alter to increase attainment levels for children
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidelines advise that schools ought to complete training regarding attachment, brain development & the impact of trauma/abuse on these, but currently most schools (primary & secondary) appear to struggle with understanding the needs of children who are no longer with birth families. This ultimately impacts negatively on these children's attainment & enjoyment of school.  We wish to make it mandatory for teachers to undergo training regarding the impact of trauma on brain development & attachment. Training should also be reviewed in order to ensure all teaching staff understand these children's needs.  Work by John Bowlby, Margaret Ainsworth, Dan Hughes, Bruce Perry, & Graham Music all provide detail about brain development, trauma & attachment.

attributes.action: Build a relief road for Buxton, Derbyshire
attributes.background: Whenever Fairfield Road in Buxton has roadworks or if an accident occurs, the Town is crippled. We need a relief road or bypass to stop the build up of traffic that happens regularly and needs to be addressed.This is a major through route and is not suitable for the volume of traffic it serves

attributes.action: Scrap land factor maintenance arrangements by companies on housing estates.
attributes.background: New estates are burdened with extra maintenance charges from private companies. The industry is unregulated, uncontrolled and monopolised in such a manner that unfairly disadvantages residents
attributes.additional_details:
There are hundreds of new build estates across the UK that are burdened with extra charges to resident for the maintenance of the open shared spaces on their estates. The residents have no choice in which company carries out the work. The charges are over inflated, the quality of work is substandard and companies bully residents into continued payments with threats of legal action. 
There seems to be no clear way of complaint, and no independent way of arbitration or enforcement of standards.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect officers tackling motorbike & auto crime
attributes.background: Police officers have high levels of training in pursuit driving & tactical resolutions yet are afraid to use tactics i.e. Stop stick on motorbikes. There is no protection in law if something goes wrong and an offender is hurt. Motorbikes fail to stop regularly, commit crime & police can't pursue.
attributes.additional_details: Many crimes are carried out on motorcycles, robberies, shootings & drug dealing. Police wont pursue in case the criminals hurt themselves & officers are scared to use stop stick in case the criminal gets injured & they get blamed. Recent incidents in Merseyside have seen up to 60 motorbikes causing mayhem at one time, many on stolen bikes, riding on pavements, through red lights etc. Legislation is needed to protect officers so they can tackle this problem effectively & put blame on offenders.

attributes.action: Increase the BASIC PAY for nurses in the NHS in line with the rise in inflation
attributes.background: Nurses and other allied health professionals pay have not had a substantial increase for many years now. We require the nurses and HCA's pay in NHS to be increased taking into account the inflation. They are a vital working group in NHS and deserve a better pay package than what they get at present.
attributes.additional_details: NHS is struggling with staffing issues and I being a nurse primarily see this as an issue because young nurses don't earn enough in the NHS and don't want to toil hard for considerably lesser amount of money. They are desperately in need of a pay rise and be in line with inflation rate. They have only received 1% pay rise in the last revision which was not a substantial increase anyway. If we have to attract more people have to come to nursing and caring they would have to be paid better.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.
attributes.background: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.To prevent losing more of our Industrial Heritage.And stop developers building on disused canals and surrounding heritage.This will also give restoration groups the possibility of restoring derelict Canals.
attributes.additional_details: Without this act being repealed ,we cannot stop any Local authorities or CRT applying for a canal closure and granting planning permission on derelict canals or nearby heritage sites.

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in religious education lessons
attributes.background: All religions should be covered in the curriculum not just the chosen few.  The younger members of society should be able to make an informed choice to what religions are around and what they stand for.

attributes.action: Government to HONOUR Britain's Worst Maritime Disaster the RMS Lancastria
attributes.background: The Lancastria sank 17th June 1940 taking with it between 5-10,000 men women and children plus pets making it Britain's Worst maritime Disaster. France have recognised the sinking, Scotland has recognised the sinking with a medal plus monument on the Clyde 2011. What have the British done-NOTHING!
attributes.additional_details: After many years writing to the British Government regarding recognition for "Britains Worst maritime Disaster!" The government choosing every year to ignore pleas and cries of not only the survivors of the disaster but also the families of those lost. Last year stand in for our Prime Minister Osborne finally acknowledged that the disaster ever took place and stated it was now "appropriate" to recognise the sinking which has brought strange feelings of mistrust and anger amongst its Nation.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums will increase to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: Urgently increase the penalty for illegal fly tipping.
attributes.background: Incidents of large scale illegal fly tipping are occurring far to frequently and the fly tips are almost on an industrial scale, especially in rural areas. It is obvious to all that organised criminals have become involved and are profiting from fly tipping.
attributes.additional_details: There is no doubt that the crime of fly tipping is having a serious effect on the countryside, wildlife and communities - it can't be allowed to go on.

attributes.action: Reinstate the NHS bursary funds for prospective 2017/2018 Nursing students.
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is that government claim there's shortage of nurses in the UK and yet they went ahead to stop the bursary that has been helpful for Nursing students to pay for their tuition fees .Government should reinstate the NHS  bursary funds to encouraging more people into nursing.

attributes.action: Pass the same sentences for offences against animals as offences against humans
attributes.background: Every day you hear of terrible offences against animals, including cruelty, torture and murder. I propose the same sentencing for perpetrators of these crimes as there would be if they had committed the same offence against a human. The current sentences passed are too light.

attributes.action: SEN Support for children without EHCPs should be as legally binding.
attributes.background: If a child has an EHCP the local authority and school and legally obliged and have a duty of care to ensure their needs are met. If a child is on SEN support but does not have an EHCP, legally the schools do not have the same obligations and so children are being let down and left unsupported.
attributes.additional_details: We would like to see this loophole being closed and ensure regardless of whether a child has an EHCP or not children who are offered SEN support are still being provided with the same opportunities and rights as a child with an EHCP. There are examples which can be provided of children who have SEN support without an EHCP who have had professional outside agencies visit the school and offer recommendations but the schools have ignored these and not put them into practice. We feel this is unfair.

attributes.action: Continue to allow reciprocal freedom of movement with EU member states
attributes.background: Freedom of movement has been a fact of life for Brits and Europeans for many years. It's a vital source of economic & social mobility for individuals, and one which benefits UK businesses & cuts red tape. Future generations should not be deprived of this right.

attributes.action: Make egg manufacturers legally obliged to display a method of male chick culling
attributes.background:
UK legislation should provide an enforceable law that every egg pack produced in an egg factory must have a clearly visible and well readable statement what killing methods of male chicks are used in the given egg factory, for example:

"Method of male chick culling: Suffocation"
attributes.additional_details:
Chick culling is a common method of a male chick disposal as males don't lay eggs and are therefore unnecessary waste generating no financial or other profit for the egg industry.

It is morally unacceptable that egg manufacturers can accompany their products with images of happy hens whilst not revealing the information about this inhumane cruelty happening on a huge scale in their factory premises on a daily basis. That is effectively deceiving the consumers by a false advertisement.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of armed forces barracks . Save our home and our heritage.
attributes.background: The closure of Sir John Moore Barracks our home our history and the county's heritage is being bulldozed to make way for affordable housing. The light infantry association members believe the barracks can be used for multi purpose venue for our wounded injured homeless personnel.
attributes.additional_details: Please see the list of objections held at the Shrewsbury Town Council. Also see the objections sent direct to Defence Secretary Michael Fallon .

attributes.action: Stop business rate rises before they wreck independent high street retailers
attributes.background: Independent retailers in many towns face rate increases which will force them out of business. National chains are pushing up property values, and independents are paying for this in their rates. Higher property values do not mean more turnover. The unintended consequence will be bland high streets.
attributes.additional_details: The new business rates have an unsound basis. Rising property values are a cost to small retailers, not a source of profit. Increasing rates in line with property values is a double burden which will be the end for many much-loved retailers, and will turn interesting high streets into identical dull parades of chain coffee shops, charity outlets, and predictable national retailers. Local councils should not be wrecking their own high streets. Business rates need to be reconsidered.

attributes.action: Review and change criteria that allow people to donate blood
attributes.background: Currently huge groups of people, such as men who have sex with men, are unable to donate blood, due to creteria based on out of date views and stereotypes. These need to be reviewed and the discrimination needs to stop! There are always adverts crying out for donors but they stop those willing!
attributes.additional_details: A gay man in a long term monogamous relationship can be denied as a donor, where a heterosexual man sleeping with multiple partners is allowed. This outdated view on men who have sex with men is fuelling the discrimination faced by them on a daily basis. This needs to be reviewed and changed and then perhaps there wouldn't be as many shortages. MSMs can be on the organ donor register and can sign up to the Anthony Nolan Trust so why shouldn't they be able to donate blood

attributes.action: Introduce a register of people who are convicted of animal cruelty
attributes.background: In light of the recent conviction for animal cruelty I am requesting the UK government to introduce a register to list the people who have been convicted and are banned from keeping animals. This would make enforcing and monitoring these bans more efficient

attributes.action: Stop The Human Rights Abuse: Suspend Diplomatic Relations with Cameroon
attributes.background:
Within the past few weeks, Cameroon police have been beating up protesters including Common Law Lawyers. Some civilians have died and many injured. 
Social media is awash with images of lawyers assaulted by security forces, their wigs and gowns confiscated

Stop this from becoming a genocide!
attributes.additional_details:
The protests,  began with Lawyers, teachers and spread to student bodies, are all against the systematic marginalisation of English-speaking Cameroonians. 
See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38078238 

See http://bareta.press/federalism-political-issue-pm-tells-lawyers/ 

THEIR DEMAND IS FOR A TWO-STATE FEDERATION WITH EQUAL AUTONOMY 

Please ask the UK to suspend diplomatic relations with Cameroon until it stops its crackdown on peaceful protesters and start listening to their demands

attributes.action: Participate in the UN conference to negotiate a Treaty to ban nuclear weapons.
attributes.background: The conference, which is set to take place in New York with the first session in March 2017, represents a significant opportunity to make real progress towards a worldwide nuclear weapons ban.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst repeatedly claiming to support multilateral nuclear disarmament, successive governments appear to have done very little towards actually bringing it about. The forthcoming United Nations conference is an opportunity for this government to send out a message globally that it is serious about achieving a world free of nuclear weapons.

attributes.action: Bring back legal aid for family law. And give fathers 50/50 rights
attributes.background: it's diabolical that legal aid has been removed from family law. Dads all over the country are not getting a fair hearing and through lack of knowledge and unfair rules that favor the mother we are loosing are kids. the law needs to be changed to stop mothers alienating fathers from their own blood
attributes.additional_details: My son saw a picture that was on my Facebook page and it stated dads are just as important as mums.  I was shocked at my 7 year old sons response he looked at it laughed and said with no hesitation no they are not and walked away. I was so upset at this because one day my boys will be dads too. And they will start life having a very  low estimate of themselves as fathers.  And I think it's time for dads to make a stand for our children...

attributes.action: Changing the structure in Early Years -  increase the UK school start age
attributes.background: Having family who relocated to Finland and seeing my 2 year old niece thrive in the Finnish education system; is a wake up call for us to change the age children start school in the UK to give them a more stable start in life.
attributes.additional_details: Research says: "Children around the age of four may not be ready for the environment they encounter in the reception class, which will include having to deal not only with a curriculum that may not be tailored to their needs but also with a number of social and emotional adjustments. These factors may cause stress and anxiety". Younger children could "be affected in a negative way by their experiences in the early years". In Finland the outcomes are more balanced as children start school later.

attributes.action: Stop the spending of £1.9million taxpayers money on a pointless wall in Calais.
attributes.background: The UK government invested over £20million of tax payers money reinforcing UK border security at the port of Calais in 2014. Stop them investing a further £1.9million on a pointless wall.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government and Calais mayor want to build a 4m high border wall around the ferry port at Calais to the tune of £1.9million of UK tax money. This would drastically affect the safety of refugees trying to cross into the UK who would have to face further devastatingly dangerous situations. The wall would also present the first border wall to be erected in Europe since the Berlin wall.

Please sign this petition if you agree we should be seeking better solutions than building pointless walls.

attributes.action: Investigate covert foreign interference in EU referendum and other UK elections.
attributes.background:
The CIA in the US and the BfV in Germany have both spoken of Russian attempts to manipulate elections. 
It is naive to think that the UK would somehow be exempt from or immune to such assaults. There are rumours that the EU referendum was similarly targeted, and future elections remain vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important that the full scale of any manipulation is known, so that trust in democracy in the UK is restored and any necessary precautions can be developed.

It is noteworthy that in the US/German cases, promoting a fear of immigrants has been a major tactic.

German BfV statement: (16 Nov 2016; Reuters) http://reut.rs/2gZS17j

US CIA/FBI statement: (16 Dec 2016; Washington Post) http://wapo.st/2h9yKg0

EU referendum: (14 Dec 2016; The Independent) http://ind.pn/2i2Jeh5

attributes.action: Increase the amount of funding allocated to our police force
attributes.background: West Yorkshire Police are stretched to capacity, more funding urgently needs to be allocated to enable the force to be more effective, match capacity to demand. Currently demand outweighs capacity, officers are under huge pressure facing assaults and huge workloads. More frontline police are needed.

attributes.action: Stop plans to allow more secondary schools to select children by ability.
attributes.background: Selection harms children, divides communities and lowers overall attainment. The 11+ exam is inherently unfair - evidence shows that it selects on the basis of prior opportunity and social background. Poorer children, including high ability poor children, lose out most.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who fail the 11+ suffer a severe blow to their self-esteem and motivation at a critical time in their development. 
Figures suggest that these children (70-80% of the total) go on to do worse at secondary modern than they would have at a comprehensive. 
Selective areas have the largest achievement gaps in the country. 
In fully selective Bucks, the 11+ pass rate for FSM children was 4% in 2014, compared to 20% for state pupils and 53% for private school pupils.

attributes.action: Exclude the Armed Forces core meal provision from the 20% VAT rate
attributes.background:
While the last review left the Daily Food Charge set at £4.79, from October the 1st the cost of a core meal at a Pay As You Dine facility will increase to £5.75 to account for VAT at the 20% rate.

No VAT should be paid on core meal provisions or proper cooking facilities should be provided.
attributes.additional_details:
The increase is due to PAYD facilities having to charge VAT on the DFC, which in turn reduces the amount of money left to actually provide the meal.

With little cooking facilities available to service personnel living in military accommodation, it is unfair to ask such personnel to pay the 20% VAT rate when they have little or no other options for cooking their own meal(s).

Core meal provisions are not a luxury and should not be charged as such.

attributes.action: Legally Recognise Nonbinary Gender Identities
attributes.background: Passports and drivers licenses have no options for those who identify outside of the gender binary, they are being misrepresented on legal documentation due to the lack of gender options. Some countries offer alternative choices such as 'X'; the UK should be taking the same steps towards equality.

attributes.action: Allow unaccompanied refugee minors in Calais be fostered or adopted in the UK.
attributes.background: "We the undersigned believe the Government needs to reconsider it's policy on the receiving of child migrants from Calais. There are many people waiting g to adopt or foster right now who could look after these children.
attributes.additional_details: Having had a fostering placement open for 4 months and knowing others in a similar situation these children can be accommodated in loving homes. There are 1500 people waiting to adopt from a pool of 500 children in the UK, numerous foster placements staying empty due to the need to place sibling groups together, when many carers can only take one child. There is space for these children and a change is needed now to prevent a humanitarian disaster on our doorstep.

attributes.action: Make legislation for toilet facilities to be provided for bus drivers on routes.
attributes.background: We want the UK Government to make legislation which will require bus operators and local authorities to provide adequate toilet facilities for bus drivers along their routes.

attributes.action: For the term 'Accountant' to be legally defined and protected.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to have the term ‘accountant’ legally defined and protected.
attributes.additional_details: This is due to us being increasingly concerned by the poor advice businesses and individuals are being given by individuals claiming to be qualified accountants, when in fact they have had little or no professional training and lack the qualifications to deal with complex financial issues.

attributes.action: Change or ease the rules surrounding 'gardens' on baby graves.
attributes.background: 8 weeks after burying my little boy, who was born asleep in June of this year, we recieved a "rule book" stating what we can and cannot do with his resting place that a paid for. Such rules included not being able to lay stones and not coming away from the headstone by more then 12" etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I know that the rules in baby gardens and what is 'allowed' differs nationally. After being asked recently to remove ALL items from my little boy's grave, I'm petitioning to get the rules at certain cemeteries eased or changed, to allow bereaved parents to decorate their child's resting place as they see fit, providing it remains maintained by the grave 'owner'. 

Buried babies may only be a plot number to some, but they are our children and deserve their own little gardens. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: Give all parents adequate support following the sudden death of a child.
attributes.background: Research has found families in Leeds have insufficient support following the sudden death of a child. The bereavement support study, commissioned by Leeds charity Elliot’s Footprint, identified that the current level of support is ineffective, leaving bereaved parents struggling and grieving alone.
attributes.additional_details:
•	Only 16% of professionals in Leeds think that child bereavement support is currently effective
•	100% of the families who had contacted the counselling service found it unsuitable due to long waiting times or lack of child bereavement experience
•	Over 50% of professionals said they did not know who coordinated child bereavement services in Leeds and 45% saw the need for a single organisation to coordinate it

attributes.action: Parliament debates the legality of EU treaties with regard to Vienna Convention.
attributes.background:
Article 53, Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties: 1969 states:  'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law.'  

Peremptory norm includes the removal of sovereignty and the removal of law not specifically repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
It is recognised that EU Treaties entail removal of National Sovereignty and abrogate National Law not specifically repealed which includes the Treason Laws.   Parliament is sovereign except that it shall not diminish its own sovereignty.

As Parliament at various times has seen fit to transfer sovereignty to the EU, it is illegal under International Law and should cease forthwith including any procedures laid down by the EU for secession from the EU and withdraw unilaterally,
